person_267.name: Abraham GottlobWerner
person_267.description: German geologist who proposed the theory of Neptunism and who also proposed the chronological sequence found in stratified rocks.

person_307.name: René JustHaüy
person_307.description: French priest, crystallographer and mineralogist who wrote the five volume Traité de minéralogie (1801). ForMemRSL.

person_377.name: JohnMayow
person_377.description: Cornish physiologist and chemist, investigated respiration especially. FRSL.

person_368.name: Horace Bénédict deSaussure
person_368.description: Genevan geologist, meteorologist, physicist, mountaineer and Alpine expolorer. Often referred to as the founder of Alpinism and modern meteorology.

person_520.name: Jean-AndréDeluc
person_520.description: Swiss-born geologist, natural philosopher and meteorologist who spent much of his time working in England. FRSL.

person_828.name: Ignazvon Born
person_828.description: von Born was a mineralogist and metallurgist in the Holy Roman Empire's age of Enlightenment

person_271.name: Alexander vonHumboldt
person_271.description: German geographer, naturalist and explorer. ForMemRSL.

person_036.name: IsaacNewton
person_036.description: Prominent English natural philosopher and mathematician greatly admired by Davy who once under the influence of several litres of nitrous oxide wrote in his notebook 'Davy & Newton' in one inch letters. FRSL.

place_021.name: Cornwall
place_021.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

place_508.name: Land's End
place_508.description: Land's End is a headland on the west coast of Cornwall. It is the most westerly point of mainland England. The underlying rock at Land's End is granite.

place_121.name: England
place_121.description: England is a country that is part of the United Kingdom. It is located on the island of Great Britain, of which it covers approximately 62%, and over 100 smaller adjacent islands.

place_208.name: Athens
place_208.description: Athens is the capital city of Greece.

place_071.name: London
place_071.description: The capital city of England and the United Kingdom.

place_825.name: River Thames
place_825.description: The River Thames, known alternatively in parts as the River Isis, is a river that flows through southern England including London.

place_994.name: Aswan
place_994.description: a city on the Nile River, which has been southern Egypt’s strategic and commercial gateway since antiquity. Davy refers to it as "Sienna in Egypt" possibly a misspelling of its former name Syene, from which the name of the rock sienite is derived.

place_741.name: Siena
place_741.description: A city in Tuscany, and the capital of the Province of Siena.

place_522.name: Coverack
place_522.description: Coverack is a coastal village and fishing port on the eastern side of the Lizard Peninsula.

place_1319.name: Padstow
place_1319.description: a town and fishing port on the north coast of Cornwall, England

place_995.name: Ben Nevis
place_995.description: the highest mountain in Scotland, the United Kingdom and the British Isles.

place_242.name: River Aw
place_242.description: The River Awe is a short river in the south-west Highlands of Scotland.

place_122.name: Wales
place_122.description: Wales is a country in southwest Great Britain known for its rugged coastline, mountainous national parks, distinctive Welsh language and Celtic culture.

place_079.name: Cumberland
place_079.description: Cumberland is a historic county in the far north-west of England.

place_470.name: Killiney
place_470.description: Killiney is a coastal area of County Dublin, Ireland. In the 19th Century it was a popular seaside resort and many of the pebbles and rocks along Killiney Beach are examples of carboniferous limestone, some of which contain fossils of corals, sea shells and other sea life that existed millions of years ago.

place_177.name: Andes
place_177.description: Mountain range in western South America.

place_530.name: Apennines
place_530.description: The Apennines are a range of mountains that run down the spine of peninsular Italy.

place_047.name: Donegal
place_047.description: Donegal is a town at the mouth of the River Eske, in north-west Ireland.

place_397.name: Dartmoor
place_397.description: Dartmoor is an upland area of southern Devon, England.

place_044.name: Wicklow
place_044.description: County Wicklow is a county in Ireland on the east coast, south of Dublin.

place_036.name: Kildare
place_036.description: Kildare is a town in County Kildare, Ireland.

place_993.name: Mayo
place_993.description: A county in the west of Ireland

place_301.name: County Antrim
place_301.description: A county in north-eastern Northern Ireland.

place_997.name: Ayr
place_997.description: a town situated on the southwest coast of Scotland

place_247.name: Alps
place_247.description: The Alps are the highest and most extensive mountain range that lies entirely in Europe. They are located in eight European countries.

place_998.name: Pyrenees
place_998.description: The Pyrenees mountain range separates the Iberian Peninsula from the rest of Europe, stretching more than 430km between Spain and France and rising higher than 3,400m in elevation.

place_999.name: Saxon Rocks
place_999.description: The Elbe Sandstone Mountains - a mountain range straddling the border between the state of Saxony in southeastern Germany and the North Bohemian region of the Czech Republic

place_878.name: United States
place_878.description: The U.S. is a country of 50 states covering a vast swath of North America, with Alaska in the northwest and Hawaii extending the nation’s presence into the Pacific Ocean.

place_003.name: Quito
place_003.description: Quito, Ecuador's capital, sits high in the Andean foothills at an altitude of 2,850m. It is constructed on the foundations of an ancient Incan city.

place_1000.name: Tibet
place_1000.description: Tibet, on the lofty Tibetan Plateau on the northern side of the Himalayas, is an autonomous region of China.

place_873.name: Iran
place_873.description: Iran, also known as Persia and officially the Islamic Republic of Iran, is a country located at the crossroads of West, Central and South Asia.

place_222.name: Africa
place_222.description: The world's second-largest and second-most populous continent.

place_1001.name: Andes of Abyssinia
place_1001.description: Davy is likely referring to the Ethiopian Highlands, a rugged mass of mountains in Ethiopia in Northeast Africa.

place_1002.name: Atlas Mountains
place_1002.description: a mountain range in the Maghreb in North Africa. It separates the Sahara Desert from the Mediterranean Sea and the Atlantic Ocean

place_1007.name: Kamchatka Krai
place_1007.description: The Kamchatka Peninsula is a 1,250-kilometre-long peninsula in the Russian Far East.
